TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WriteCodeFragment extends Microsoft.Build.Tasks.TaskExtension

Docs.summary: Generates a temporary code file with the specified generated code fragment. Does not delete the file.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the attributes to write.
Docs.value: An item whose value is the full type name of the attribute. For example, "System.AssemblyVersionAttribute".

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each piece of metadata is the name-value pair of a parameter, which must be of type System.String.
Some attributes only allow positional constructor arguments, or the user may just prefer them. To set those, use metadata names like "_Parameter1", "_Parameter2" etc. If a parameter index is skipped, it's an error.

Docs.returns: if the code fragment was written; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the language of code to generate.
Docs.value: The language of code to generate.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Language name can be any language for which a CodeDom provider is available. For example, "C#", "VisualBasic". The file emitted is given the default extension for that language.

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the path to the file that was generated.
Docs.value: The path to the file that was generated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If setting this property with a file name, the destination folder will be prepended.
If setting this property with a rooted value, the destination folder will be ignored.
If this property is not set, WriteCodeFragment uses the destination folder, an arbitrary file name, and the default extension for the language selected.
